name: A. Two Problems
statement:
A boy Valera registered on site as , and wrote his first . He boasted to
a friend Arkady about winning as much as points for his first contest.
But Arkady did not believe his friend’s words and decided to check
whether Valera could have shown such a result.He knows that the contest
number was unusual because there were only two problems. The contest
lasted for minutes, the minutes are numbered starting from zero. The
first problem had the initial cost of points, and every minute its cost
reduced by points. The second problem had the initial cost of points,
and every minute this cost reduced by points. Thus, as soon as the zero
minute of the contest is over, the first problem will cost points, and
the second problem will cost points. It is guaranteed that at any moment
of the contest each problem has a non-negative cost.Arkady asks you to
find out whether Valera could have got exactly points for this contest.
You should assume that Valera could have solved any number of the
offered problems. You should also assume that for each problem Valera
made no more than one attempt, besides, he could have submitted both
problems at the same minute of the contest, starting with minute and
ending with minute number . Please note that Valera can’t submit a
solution exactly minutes after the start of the contest or later.
